Tickt.co

Fight Coronavirus

COVID-19 has forced many ticket cancellations for countless events. Wouldn't it be great if we make this a good thing?

Donate

Donate to COVID-19 Solidarity Response Fund

If you've recently asked for a return on a cancelled or postponed concert, festival, conference... please consider a donation to World Health Organization for the COVID-19 Solidarity Response Fund. Donations can be made in honor to your favorite rock band, pop star or conference organisation, and they are a great opportunity to turn the dissapointment of not being able to attend that event into a global solidarity effort to fight an unprecedented challenge.

Frequently Asked Questions

Where does my money go?

Donations support WHO’s work, including with partners, to track and understand the spread of the virus; to ensure patients get the care they need and frontline workers get essential supplies and information; and to accelerate research and development of a vaccine and treatments for all who need them. Some donations also support Fund partners UNICEF, for its work on COVID-19 among vulnerable communities including children, and the vaccine development alliance CEPI.

Why shouldn't I just directly donate to WHO?

Please, do! Tickt.co only promotes money donated in honor of rock bands, pop artists or other events to keep track of the solidarity effort coming from cancelled tickets. That could allow us to push the industry to further collaborate with the effort to fight Coronavirus and recognise the collaborative effort of the fans.

Does Tickt.co keep any money for themselves?

No. Ticket.co does not, and will not, receive any money from the donations you make. 100% of the money you donate goes directly to WHO Covid-19 Solidarity Response Fund. Ticket.co is a nonprofit project, and any benefits derived from running this site will be donated to COVID-19 Solidarity Response Fund.

Why do you do this?

Because we are fans ourselves, and we live in an unprecedented challenging time. Like you, we had tickets for concerts that were cancelled or posponed to 2021, and we thought it would be great to be able to turn that disappointment into something good.

Tickt.co is a nonprofit project and is not affiliated with WHO or any other parties. We do not receive, and will not receive, any money from the donations you make. All benefits will be donated to COVID-19 Solidarity Response Fund.

We use cookies to personalise content, to provide social media features and to analyse our traffic. We also share information about your use of our site with our social media, advertising and analytics partners. If you want to change your cookie setting, please see the ‘how to reject cookies' section of our Cookie Policy. Otherwise, if you agree to our use of cookies, please continue to use our website.
